name: AsanaUpdateWebhookFilters
description:
Update filters for an Asana webhook.

Use this tool to update the filters of an existing Asana webhook by providing new filter specifications. The existing filters will be completely replaced with the new ones provided.

parameters.name: webhook_global_id
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the webhook to update its filters.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the webhook.

parameters.name: updated_webhook_filters
parameters.description: JSON object with 'filters' array detailing new filters for the webhook.

filters.description: An array of WebhookFilter objects to specify a whitelist of filters to apply to events from this webhook. If a webhook event passes any of the filters the event will be delivered; otherwise no event will be sent to the receiving server.

value_schema.description: The updated filters for the webhook.

parameters.name: include_optional_properties
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of optional properties to include in the response.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: enable_pretty_output
parameters.description: Enable this to receive the response in a human-readable format with line breaking and indentation. Recommended only for debugging as it increases response size and time.

value_schema.description:
Provides “pretty” output.
Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the asana API.

parameters.description:

Provides the response in a “pretty” format. In the case of JSON this means doing proper line breaking and indentation to make it readable. This will take extra time and increase the response size so it is advisable only to use this during debugging.

parameters.name: opt_fields
parameters.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

value_schema.description: This endpoint returns a resource which excludes some properties by default. To include those optional properties, set this query parameter to a comma-separated list of the properties you wish to include.

parameters.name: webhook_gid
parameters.description: Globally unique identifier for the webhook.

value_schema.description: Globally unique identifier for the webhook.

parameters.name: requestBody
parameters.description: The updated filters for the webhook.

filters.description: An array of WebhookFilter objects to specify a whitelist of filters to apply to events from this webhook. If a webhook event passes any of the filters the event will be delivered; otherwise no event will be sent to the receiving server.

value_schema.description: The updated filters for the webhook.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
